data.name: DataPilotField
desc: represents a single field in a data pilot table.
If the data pilot table is based on a spreadsheet cell range, a field is represented by a column of the range and is named using the topmost cell of the column.
**since**
LibreOffice 5.3

types.name: Subtotals
desc: specifies the functions used to calculate subtotals for this field.
This property is supported by column and row fields only.

An empty sequence means no subtotals. The same effect can be achieved by setting the property Function to the value GeneralFunction.NONE. If the length of the sequence is greater than 1, then the sequence MUST NOT contain one of the values GeneralFunction.NONE or GeneralFunction.AUTO.
The order of the functions in this sequence is reflected in the DataPilot table. Multiple entries of the same function are ignored when setting the property.

types.name: Subtotals2
desc: specifies the functions used to calculate subtotals for this field.
This property is supported by column and row fields only.

An empty sequence means no subtotals. The same effect can be achieved by setting the property Function2 to the value GeneralFunction.NONE. If the length of the sequence is greater than 1, then the sequence MUST NOT contain one of the values GeneralFunction2.NONE or GeneralFunction2.AUTO.
The order of the functions in this sequence is reflected in the DataPilot table. Multiple entries of the same function are ignored when setting the property.
**since**
LibreOffice 5.3

properties.name: AutoShowInfo
desc: enables the automatic inclusion of only a number of items with the highest or lowest result values.

properties.name: Function
desc: specifies the function used to calculate results for this field.
For column and row fields, this is the function for subtotals (GeneralFunction.NONE means no subtotals). For data fields, this is the function shown in the data pilot table.

properties.name: Function2
desc: specifies the function used to calculate results for this field.
For column and row fields, this is the function for subtotals (GeneralFunction2.NONE means no subtotals). For data fields, this is the function shown in the data pilot table.
**since**
LibreOffice 5.3

properties.name: GroupInfo
desc: contains the grouping information of the DataPilot field.
By changing the value of this property it is possible to modify the grouping settings of this field.

properties.name: HasAutoShowInfo
desc: specifies whether this field has auto show information.

properties.name: HasLayoutInfo
desc: specifies whether this field has layout information.

properties.name: HasReference
desc: specifies whether this field has a reference.

properties.name: HasSortInfo
desc: specifies whether this field has sorting information.

properties.name: IsGroupField
desc: specifies whether this field is a group field.

properties.name: LayoutInfo
desc: controls how the field's items are laid out in the result table.

properties.name: Orientation
desc: specifies the orientation of the field.
If the orientation of a field has been changed using this property, the field will be moved to the last position in the collection of all fields with the specified orientation.

properties.name: Reference
desc: controls how the results are shown in relation to a selected reference result.

properties.name: SelectedPage
desc: specifies the selected page which is used to filter the data pilot.

properties.name: ShowEmpty
desc: specifies whether to show this field also if it is empty or not.

properties.name: SortInfo
desc: controls how the field's items are sorted.

properties.name: UseSelectedPage
desc: specifies whether to use the selected page to filter the data pilot or show all.

properties.name: UsedHierarchy
desc: specifies which hierarchy of the dimension is used.
